item.title: Engine modularity
item.description: Modularity Historically, we believe there are three types of approaches to game development: Description Opinionated? Modularity? Note Libraries Not at all Extremely No natural interoperability, lots of glue code required Frameworks Somewhat Very Often unable to provide high-level experiences due to modularity Engines Extremely Not at all Provides high-level experiences but makes rigid choices on your behalf The Mach project provides some Libraries, but mostly aims to sit between Frameworks and Engines.

item.title: Standard library
item.description: Standard library The Mach standard library can be found at: github.com/hexops/mach - it is modular by design and you may choose to use depend on all of it, or just some of it. Using mach.math as a separate library Let’s take for example mach.math, our math library. Unlike other gamedev math libraries which may try to support a bunch of different coordinate systems in order to support various graphics APIs, ours is specifically for Mach’s design goals.
